properties.publicTransport: Route 389 buses will be diverting around Stanley St while it's closed for the event. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney – Sydney Streets event on Stanley Street. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Stanley St will be closed between Yurong St and Crown St in both directions from 9am to 11:30pm
  • Sections of Riley St, Yurong St and Chapel St will also be closed during this time
  • Motorists will be detoured via Crown St, William St, College St and Francis St

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Stanley St, Riley St, Yurong St, Crown St and Chapel St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures & Special Event Clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
Lane closures and parking restrictions will be in place on sections of Flinders St on Friday night to allow for the installation of the parade grandstand ahead of the Mardi Gras Parade on Saturday night. 

Lane closures:

  • From 11pm Fri 1 Mar to 6am Sat 2 Mar - Lanes 1 and 2 northbound on Flinders St between Moore Park Rd and Linden Ln
  • From 6am to 1pm Sat 2 Mar - Lane 1 northbound on Flinders St between Moore Park Rd and Linden Ln
  • From 1pm to 4pm Sat 2 Mar - Lanes 1 and 2 northbound on Flinders St between Moore Park Rd and Oxford St
  • From 4pm Sat 2 Mar until 3am Sun 3 Mar - Flinders St will be fully closed northbound
  • From 4.30pm Sat 2 Mar until 3am Sun 3 Mar - Flinders St will be fully closed southbound.

For full details on parade closures in the city, Darlinghurst and Moore Park from 3pm Sat 2 March see the event entry.

Special event clearways will be in effect on the western side of Flinders St between Moore Park Rd and Oxford St from 10pm Fri 1 Mar to 2am Sun 3 March. Clearways will also be in effect on Short St and Hill St during this time.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.
properties.displayName: Mardi Gras Parade event infrastructure installation

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Gay & Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade 2024

properties.publicTransport: Buses between the city and the east will be diverting and using different stops from 3pm while major roads are closed. Museum Station will be closed from 5pm until 4am for crowd safety. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Hundreds of thousands of spectators will line the streets to see the Sydney Gay & Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade travel from Hyde Park to Moore Park via Oxford St, Flinders St and Anzac Pde from 7:30pm until around 11.30pm.

Road closures and parking restrictions will be in place from as early as 3pm and most roads remain closed until 3am Sunday.

Pedestrian crossing of the parade route on Oxford St and Flinders St will be available until 7pm before the event gets underway, after 7pm there is no pedestrian crossing permitted until the parade concludes. 

KEY ROAD CLOSURES

  • From 3pm to midnight: sections of College St, Wentworth Ave and surrounding local streets.
  • From 3pm to 3am: sections of Bourke St, Campbell St and surrounding local streets in Surry Hills.
  • From 4pm to 3am: Flinders St northbound lanes from Moore Park Rd to Oxford St.
  • From 4:30pm to 12.30am: roads between Elizabeth St and Albion St including Reservoir St, Commonwealth St, Campbell St and surrounding local roads. Access will be managed for residents.
  • From 4.30pm to midnight: Liverpool St between Elizabeth St and College St westbound lanes, (eastbound closed until 3am), and local streets in Surry Hills between Elizabeth St and Riley St
  • From 4.30pm to 3am: Oxford St between College St and Darlinghurst Rd, Flinders St southbound from Oxford St, sections of Crown St, sections of South Dowling between Oxford St and Fitzroy St, and southbound Anzac Pde from Moore Park Rd to Lang Rd, including the Eastern Distributor Randwick Anzac Pde off-ramp (Bondi exit remains open).
  • From 6.30pm to 1am: Moore Park Rd westbound from Oatley Rd to South Dowling St, and Driver Ave between Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd (until 10am Sunday).
  • From 9pm to 11.30pm: sections of Elizabeth St, Castlereagh St and Pitt St between Market St and Goulburn St will close to allow crowds to safely leave the CBD.

Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the CBD and Moore Park and to expect delays as traffic will be heavy on detour routes.

Motorists travelling between the city and eastern suburbs will be diverted via Cleveland St in the south or via William St and Darlinghurst Rd in the north.  

Special event clearways will be in effect between 6am Saturday and 3am Sunday on various roads along and surrounding the parade route in the Sydney CBD, Darlinghurst, Surry Hills and Moore Park. Some clearways will be in effect from 10pm Friday.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: via Oxford Street, Flinders Street and Anzac Parade

properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend Lunar New Year celebrations in the Cabramatta Town Centre. Event runs 11am to 9pm on Saturday and 10am to 4pm on Sunday.

Heavy traffic is expected on Railway Pde, Cumberland Hwy and Cabramatta Rd West as crowds travel to and from the event. 

From 8pm Friday 23 February, Park Road and Arthur Street will be closed in the Cabramatta CBD and will reopen at 2am on Monday 26 February. Motorists will be detoured via local roads.

Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:
CABRAMATTA // 8PM FRI 23 FEB to 2AM MON 26 FEB

  • Park Road between Hughes Street and Arthur Street
  • Arthur Street between Park Road and Railway Parade
  • Arthur Street Car Park – note that Denton Lane will re-open at 2am Sunday 25 February for deliveries only.

The Hughes Street Car Park will remain open, and Taxis can access the Arthur Street Taxi Stand.
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

properties.otherAdvice:
Matchbox Twenty at Qudos Bank Arena on Tuesday & Thursday night. Show starts 7pm each night, and finishes around 11pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to the show in the busy evening peak.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
Silver Slipper Stakes Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 12:25pm, last race from 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

Freestyle Kings Live at Industree Group Stadium. Start at 6:30pm, finish at 8:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the event.

Dane Dr will close from 4pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

A-League Men: Newcastle Jets v Macarthur FC at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick-off from 6pm, finish around 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Some light rail and bus services may experience delays. Check service alerts at transportnsw.info for the latest information.
properties.otherAdvice:
Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on Forbes Street for a planned Police Operation.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am to 2pm:

  • Forbes Street from top of the street to halfway point of Forbes Street (western side)
  • Forbes Street from Car Share parking to halfway point of Forbes Street (eastern side)

 Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

NRL Pre-Season Challenge: Sea Eagles v Broncos at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. Kick-off from 5:55pm, full-time around 7:55pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and plan to arrive early as parking will be in high demand, and also be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Sydney Streets Glebe

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 370, 431 and 433 will be diverting around road closures and missing some stops. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney - Sydney Streets event on Glebe Point Rd. The event runs from 11am until 10pm.

  • Glebe Point Rd will be closed between Broadway and St Johns Rd from 9am to 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Norton St, Mitchell St, Cowper St, Derwent Ln, Derby Pl and Francis St will also be closed during this time.
  • Motorists can detour around the closures via St Johns Rd and Derwent St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Glebe Point Rd, Francis St, Derby Pl, Cowper St, Norton St and Mitchell St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES // 9AM - 11:30PM

  • Glebe Point Road between Broadway and St Johns Road
  • Norton Street between Campbell Lane and Glebe Point Road

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Melbourne City at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off at 5:30pm, full time around 7:15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3:30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd (car park open from 2:30pm).
  • EP2 Kippax car park will not be open for this match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 9pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 3,000 particpants are expected to take part in this year's Bobbin Head Cycle Classic. Events start and finish at Karuah Oval in Turramurra, from 6:30am. All events will finish by 1:30pm. Changed traffic conditions will be in effect along the course for the safety of participants.

Road and lane closures will be in place along the course at various locations and times between 5am and 3pm, including on sections of Karuah Rd, Turramurra Ave, Bobbin Head Rd, Warrimoo Ave, Woodbury Rd, General San Martin Dr, Old Pacific Hwy and Mona Vale Rd through Turramurra, Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park, Mt Colah, St Ives and Terry Hills. 

Speed limit reductions will be in effect at key locations at various times between 6am and 2pm.

A special event clearway will also be in place on the eastern side of a section of Mona Vale Rd in St Ives from 7am until 1:30pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully for the most up-to-date information as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

properties.otherAdvice:
The Trial Run Australia event will see participants running along the shoreline of Lake Jindabyne at sunrise before heading into Thredbo Valley along the banks of the Thredbo River.

Alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place on Kosciuszko Rd to allow motorists to pass in one direction at a time.

Motorists are reminded to slow down and follow the directions of traffic controllers.

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Gay & Lesbian Mardi Gras Bondi Beach party

properties.publicTransport: Frequent route 333 buses run between Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Gay & Lesbian Mardi Gras Bondi Beach party will be held near Bondi Pavilion. The event starts from 2pm finishing by 10pm.

With large crowds expect, traffic approaching Bondi Beach will be heavy along Bondi Rd, Old South Head Rd and Syd Einfeld Dr. Motorists should avoid the area where possible or allow plenty of extra travel time and prepare for delays. 

Local roads and carparks at Bondi Beach will be closed before, during and after the event between 19 February and 28 February, including on sections of Queen Elizabeth Dr and Park Drive South. Special event clearways will also be in effect.

  • From 5pm Monday 19 February to 6am Tuesday 27 February: Park Drive South car parking bays 248 to 410 western side will be closed, and Park Drive South car parking bays 294 to 004 eastern side will be closed, and clearway parking restrictions will be in effect.
  • From 3pm Friday 23 February to 6am Sunday 25 February: Queen Elizabeth Drive car parking bays from Campbell Parade roundabout to Bondi Pavilion pedestrian crossing will be closed, and clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on both sides.
  • From 12pm to 11pm on Saturday 24 February: special event clearways will be in effect on sections of Bondi Rd, Campbell Pde, Grafton St and Hall St.
  • From 4pm to 11pm on Saturday 24 February: special event clearways will be in effect on Bondi Rd between Sandridge St and Oxford St southern side only.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Car park closures and special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect around Bondi Beach to support the Bondi Beach Party event on Saturday 24 February. Changed parking arrangements will be in effect before, during and after the event as per the dates and times below.

From 5pm Monday 19 February to 6am Tuesday 27 February:

  • Park Drive South car parking bays 248 to 410 western side will be closed, and clearway parking restrictions will be in effect and Park Drive South car parking bays 294 to 004 eastern side will be closed, and clearway parking restrictions will be in effect.

From 3pm Friday 23 February to 6am Sunday 25 February:

  • Queen Elizabeth Drive car parking bays from Campbell Parade roundabout to Bondi Pavilion pedestrian crossing will be closed, and clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on both sides.

From 12pm to 11pm on Saturday 24 February:

  • Bondi Road Between Sandridge Street and Francis Street eastern side
  • Campbell Parade between Queen Elizabeth Drive (entry) and Queen Elizabeth Drive (exit) eastern side
  • Campbell Parade median parking between Beach Road and Wairoa Avenue (8 parking spaces opposite Bondi Beach Public School) centre median
  • Campbell Parade between Brighton Boulevard and Hastings Parade (North Bondi Bus Interchange) both sides / centre median
  • Campbell Parade between Notts Avenue and Queen Elizabeth Drive eastern side
  • Campbell Parade between Sir Thomas Mitchell Road and Lamrock Avenue western side
  • Grafton Street between Grosvenor Street and Newland Street
  • Hall Street between Gould Lane and Campbell Parade (Accessible Drop Off and Pick Up Zone) northern side

From 4pm to 11pm on Saturday 24 February:

  • Bondi Road between Sandridge Street and Oxford Street southern side only.
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures and Special Event Clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
Shimano Husky Triathlon Festival will take place from the 23 February to the 25 February, with 300 participants competing.

The cycling component will occur on Bowen St, Nowra St, Fegan St, Hawke St, Owen St, Sydney St, Tomerong St & Woollamia Rd, with local road closures in place.

Speed reduction and stop slow traffic control will be in place at various locations along Kosciuszko Road between Jindabyne and Sawpit Creek.

Motorists driving in the area should reduce speed, allow extra travel time and exercise caution as there will be participants on foot.

webLinks.linkText: Cinema under the stars event page

properties.otherAdvice:
Cinema under the stars will be held at Speers Point Park, The Esplanade on Saturday 24 February.

On the Esplanade just near Park Road there will be a portable signalised pedestrian crossing to allow for the increase in pedestrian activity.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, reduce speed and watch for pedestrians.
A march is taking place with a rolling closure under police escort.

WNBL: Sydney Flames v Southside Flyers at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip-off from 3pm, full time around 4:50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park, including on the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road as fans travel to and from the match.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Western Sydney Wanderers at Industree Group Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm, full time around 6:50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close from 2:30pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run each night. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Taylor Swift | The Eras Tour at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park, Friday - Monday nights. Gates open at 4:30pm, show starts from 6:20pm, finish around 11pm each night.

With 300,000 fans expected over four nights significant traffic delays are expected, particularly on Friday and Monday during the busy evening peaks.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • CAR PARK UPDATE: all available parking spaces in Olympic Park are SOLD OUT for Friday 23 and Saturday 24 February. Spaces are limited and selling fast for Sunday and Monday nights, pre-book online now to secure a space. A flat rate $35 parking fee will apply.
  • Do not drive unless you have pre-booked parking as there will be no parking available on site. You will need to catch public transport.
  • Consider parking at a nearby train station commuter carpark and continuing your trip on one of the many extra trains running to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • A dedicated drop off zone will be located on Australia Ave opposite P6 Car park. Pick up zone will be available in the P6 Car park, entry via Bennelong Pkway and Murray Rose Ave.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct from Friday to Monday to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

properties.otherAdvice:
Blink 182 at Qudos Bank Arena on Friday 23 and Saturday 24 February. Show starts from 7:30pm each night, and finishes around 10:15pm.

Significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct with a combined crowd of 100,000 expected in the precinct each night as Taylor Swift | The Eras Tour also takes place at neighbouring Accor Stadium.

Allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park, including on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • CAR PARK UPDATE: all available parking spaces in Olympic Park are SOLD OUT for Friday 23 and Saturday 24 February.
  • Do not drive unless you have pre-booked parking as there will be no parking available on site. You will need to catch public transport.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing the trip to Olympic Park by train as frequent additional services will run.
  • A dedicated drop off zone will be located on Australia Ave opposite P6 Car park. Pick up zone will be available in the P6 Car park, entry via Bennelong Pkway and Murray Rose Ave.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct from Friday to Monday to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Route 356, 373 and 375 buses will be detouring. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Spot Festival in Randwick on St Pauls Street and Perouse Road from 1pm until 8pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads in the area while crowds travel to and from the event, and road closures are in place. Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

From 4am, sections of Perouse Road and St Pauls Street will be closed until midnight. Motorists will be detoured via local roads. 

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in the area on sections of Perouse Road, St Pauls Street, Nancy Street and Soudan Street.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location
